cyclone.name: BILL
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles SE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the central Texas coast with inland movement across south-central Texas after landfall; eastern quadrants sweep across the upper Texas and western Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor, TX (central Texas coast)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Baffin Bay to High Island, TX (ends west of Port Arthur)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and upper Texas coast eastward into western Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds possible: sustained 25–35 mph with gusts to 45 mph Tuesday afternoon-evening.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises 2–4 ft above ground level possible along the upper Texas coast, including Sabine Pass and approaches to Port Arthur.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher amounts up to 12 inches could cause flash flooding near the port and along the Sabine-Neches Waterway.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; brief white-out squalls could reduce visibility for vessel traffic.
